intro: Semaphyllanthe obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate semaphyllanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, ovate-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Semaphyllanthe obovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
